alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Powell; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Powell, northwestern Laurel, northwestern Owsley, Estill, northeastern Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle, Lee and southwestern Wolfe Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Palmer to 8 miles southwest of Stanford. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Irvine, Hargett, Wiseman Crossing Station, Calloway Crossing, Sandhill, North Irvine, Weedon, Fox, West Irvine and Palmer around 550 PM EDT. Ravenna, Cottage Furnace, Hardwick, Willow Tree, Cow Creek and Doe Creek around 555 PM EDT. Furnace, Fitchburg, Cobhill, Indian Lakes Park, Bee Lick, Pitts, Gum Sulphur, Bandy, Pryse and Texola around 600 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pilot, See, Ottowa, Patsey, Quail, Bromo, Greeley, Willailla, Level Green, Crystal, Mount Vernon, Standing Rock, Leeco, Maretburg, Zachariah, Lake Linville, Spiro, Renfro Valley, Zoe, Wabp, Fincastle, Burr, Booth, Flat Rock, Pine Hill, Torrent, Whisman, Orlando, Wellhope, Dudley Station, Sinks, Withers, Donaro, Grannie, Gauley, Mary, Jep Hill, Flat, Sand Hill, Robinet, Horse Lick, Cruise, Templer, Lamero, Mershons, Dango, Camp Wildcat, Hazel Patch and Loam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Powell; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wolfe
